availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Hooe (Mercer County, lawyer and state representative)

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, attorney and state representative. Married to Nancy McAfee Hooe. Married to Sue Burford Hooe on February 3, 1858. Father of Joseph A. Hooe, Mary Hooe, Edward B. Hooe, Robert M. Hooe, William A. Hooe Jr., Emmet M. Hooe, Frank Hooe, Nannie Hooe, and Willie Hooe. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1843 and 1849. Attorney in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1851 to 1853. Attorney in Harrodsburg in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrodsburg in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District1, p. 273A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 27.
Dodd, Jordan, Kentucky Marriages, 1851-1900, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1882), p. 603-604.
